application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: T2 and T3 Oaks are situated within the back gardens of 14 and 16 Briarwood Drive respectively. These trees both present mature and attractive crowns. Views of the crowns can be gained between the houses and over the roofs from multiple angles from Briarwood Drive and Hazelwood Drive. These Oaks have high amenity value and make a significant positive contribution to the local landscape.

In the application to carry out tree works on these two Oaks, the applicant failed to indicate the proposed amount of pruning on the branches of the trees to match the boundary. Furthermore, no reasons have been provided to justify the requested works, nor an Arboricultural Report has been supplied in support of the application. A site visit and email contact from the Council's Tree Officer was unsuccessfully attempted.
Sufficient information has not been provided to determine the suitability of this application, and adequate justification for the works has not been demonstrated.
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
description: To carry out tree surgery, including to cut back to boundary branches overhanging the garden of 15 Briarwood Drive to Two Oaks, T2 and T3 on TPO 691
